title: What will be the closing price of Mercado Libre stock on 15 February 2021?
preds: Based on 1 year daily closing price data and variances
Price won't fluctuate that much over the remaining time period.
Correction I due to US market being closed on Monday; delay in release of earnings postponed to 2/23 after hours.

Mercado Libre has had a year range of $422.22 - $2,020.00, but hasn't closed above $1,989.00 this year. As it stands now the closing price is at about 1942.25. This is within a reasonable range for both 1,8000 - 2,000 and 2,000-2,200. Ill come back tomorrow to see where it stands then.
Trend of other forecasters since a lot of weeks

Mecardo Libre has experienced rapid growth in terms of sales. Net revenue has increased exponentially and without exception since the beginning of 2020, and 2021 saw the greatest annual proportional increase in sales in the company's history [1]. Due to COVID-19, and by virtue of the company being an online service, it can be expected for these sales numbers to only continue to improve as COVID-related restrictions persist under the new administration. Paired with penetration growth of 387%, I suspect that Libre's stock value will continue to rise with time, but not passing the $2,200 mark[2]. https://www.statista.com/statistics/730583/mercadolibre-quarterly-revenue/#:~:text=In%20the%20third%20quarter%20of,2.23%20billion%20dollars%20in%202019. https://seekingalpha.com/article/4404198-mercadolibre-growth-ahead
Updating for current position and time

The gap to higher bracket is with $1,918, just 4.3% in the next 5 days
- In the last ~500 trading days (Jan 2019), this stock experienced 159 days with such a period increase (~30%)
- Recent severe pullbacks have been the Sept tantrum + Vaccine Announcement
- Upside swings came from Earnings Presentations (next release after this challenge closes - Feb 25th)  or other announcements (BoA Buy upgrade; Notes offering) Therefore lowering odds on USD 2,000+ since this week is earnings light https://deviantlookingdata.com/mercadolibre-share-price-growth-trajectory/

There are 6 trading days to go and MELI most recently closed at $1918. However, with a trailing month high of $1984 and strong upward momentum in the market, it's quite possible we see a close above $2000. A correction or even crash is not impossible, of course.
Update for time remaining. Also, current price has recovered to within 2.5% of the split between the $1.8-2k and $2-2.2k brackets, and market momentum appears to be holding.
Adjusting based on the current stock price.
Updated, missed trajectory going downward, so most likely will stay within the 1800-2000 range.

Stock price sitting at $1889.43 with 12 days to go and strong upward trajectory.  Always possible it can drop or stagnate, but most likely will crest $2,000. https://www.google.com/search?q=mercado+libre+stock&rlz=1C5CHFA_enUS542US665&oq=mercado+libre+stock&aqs=chrome..69i57j0i10l5j69i60j69i61.2402j1j4&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8https://finance.yahoo.com/news/mercadolibre-meli-earnings-expected-grow-173005060.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbS8&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAAGIGV4SjveUDI7uJhQZ5kZrL7CR8EcZKXntqIzOdE4Z9V7P0qswNLagBLQFKxVerFpvCcDkrD8tlxmdWjER80i9SW2gFeabou1FpjS2L9sXg1-qScziBdJM0N54pQOEDOuc5TlcWlRn5kpbTGglWNK5W6xDTWodaxuM-5Qv4FUk0https://simplywall.st/stocks/us/retail/nasdaq-meli/mercadolibre/news/the-returns-at-mercadolibre-nasdaqmeli-provide-us-with-signs

Revising my initial forecast as January presented another strong month for the stock. Other than a short stint below 1600 around JAN 7, the stock has trended mostly upward throughout the month. Today's earnings call could shed an important light on the where the stock goes for the next few weeks. Analysts expect strong revenue growth and a strong growth in a dividend. A beat of those expecations could send the stock to new highs, including excliping the 2000 mark. Although it may only be temporary. A miss on those numbers should send the stock down lower toward the 1600 mark. It will all come down to where the numbers fall in relation to the estimates.
Playing around given recent rally. Think I need more prob in the upside price scenarios.
Adjusting for time and current price. Think the next couple of weeks market will be relatively weak.

MELI gave up most of its gains since the last update in a rough week, falling 11.29%.  However, it is still up 5.3% for the month and 44.74% for the past 3 months. Expecting a modest improvement over current prices in light of unusually high market volatility. A 10% gain from today's price ($1779.51) would still raise the value to $1957.46, close to the seam between the two mid-range options. Therefore, the preponderance of probability lies within this range. Again, considering volatility and a muted outlook for the continuation/resurgence of a rally this quarter, favoring the more conservative option.

@SE_Meyer provided a lovely thorough explanation a while back for why this stock is so volatile.  While it is more comforting to know why something is happening than having no idea, the fact that it's volatile may still make predicting chancy.  There are useful distinctions to be made among the notions of volatility, uncertainty, complexity and ambiguity.  Sorting out which of those four, alone or in combination, is the dominant source of unease can help in figuring out what to do about the issue, unless it can't.

Updated forecast. Decreased change op >1.600 due to recent buy recommendations and stock movements. Increased change of 1.800 - 2.000 and 2.000 - 2.200. 
Also slightly lowered change on 1.600 - 1.800 and slightly increased change of > 2.200

It  appears that 2,000USD (which has been hit in the pre-market trading on 25 Jan 2021) is just too much for the time being, with no news. Maybe this changes when earnings report is due approx. two weeks from now.

Current price has increased to S1965.05 to close out the week, which beats my original mid-February target. Continuing the trend as previously calculated places the final price within the $2k-2.2k range.
Updated for latest share price. Assuming c. 300 1 month sd and slightly skewing upwards
Mr Bloom site has a pile of cookies, beacons, banners and stuff

This is a very weirdly behaving stock, which I suppose means I should care enough to figure out why.  Probably I won't, though.  This should at least improve everybody else's scores, albeit perhaps imperceptibly.
As of 15 Jan, stock price is at $1845.  Project it will likely stay between the 1600-2000 range. Will revisit in February.
As @SE_Meyer said, this stock is crazy.

Right now market cap is $87B, revenues are $3b and it is not making a profit.  Also, the current price is about 25 times annual sales, and a year ago the stock was trading for $422/sh.    On the other hand, revenue has increase by about 2.5 times year over year.  I found an article on yahoo finance that said in just the last few years about 50 percent of the 600 million people in their market place have  gone from 100 percent cash to becoming "banked" (e.g., have access to bank accounts, pre-paid cards, investing through Mercado Fondo).   The head of investor relations said Mercado Libre is well positioned to take advantage of this development.  Therefore, the stock is in a bubble, but there is still at least some very positive press.  At about 25 times sales and a negative p/e, the stock price should fall even if the revenue doubled again.     I remember from the dot.com boom (I live in silicon valley so I probably remember it better than most), it took a while for the public to stop pumping money into overpriced stocks.  I remember talking to people about how overpriced a particular stock was and how they were still going to buy it because it was still going up.    Hence, speculation (aka the greater fool theory) is still alive and well.    Since the end date is only six weeks away, I suspect the price will still be quite high.  https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/?symbol=meli&qsearchterm=meli&tab=financials https://www.fool.com/investing/2021/01/11/heres-what-should-have-mercadolibre-investors-most/?source=eptyholnk0000202&utm_source=yahoo-host&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=article
Correcting my answer as the stock has appreciated
Inferred from an implied volatility estimate of 50% annualized.

Given: A starting price of $643 a year ago; currently $1719 as of 9 January = 167.16% increase annually, or average 13.93% monthly. If the current trend holds, this puts $1,958.46 as an approximate target for mid-February.  With increasing COVID cases, expanding variants, and low enthusiasm to vaccinate (example - 80% of US healthcare workers are unwilling to be "guinea pigs" and will wait until additional safety/efficacy data becomes available before getting a shot per The Economist), the current economic and investment trend is very likely (80%) to hold at least through Q1 '21.
Looks like I'm crazy, but it's just the stock that behaves like crazy...

Looking at share price charts for this company and looking at some of the literature I would say that this company is achieving sustained growth with an extra boost from social change due to Covid but also as its products are a brilliant fit within its consumer base.    A share prices go up and down in a way that can not be predicted with any certainty I would simply project the growth curve forward and suggest that share prices will continue to grow and will reach about the 1800 mark.      I will take a look at other features of the company and adjust my view accordingly.

Mercadolibre is still seeing growth in their user base. Analysts appear to think the stock will continue to be strong in 2021 which should help it hold the astronomical growth it saw in 2020. The company is likely to report its Q4 earnings the first week of Feb. A strong number should send the stock higher in the short-term but its unlikely reach the 2,000 mark. Although it has spiked a few times, it has seemed to settle into the 1550-1650 range for the short-term.

Given the resent rise in the last 12 months from about 600 to 1600 I put the larges change on the <1600 and 1600-1800. Although the ecommerce market in South America looks promising I doubt last years rise in stock price would have been possible without the Covid-19 ecommerce boost and a global rise in stock markets due to low interest rates. Both effect are unlikely to produce a similar boost this period. 
Given the short time window I expect the stock price to hover around 1600.
Slight change for it to rise above 1800.
Small change it will rise above 2000 but due to high volatility not completely excluded.
Current price is always a good approximation (especially given the short timeframe) so 1600-1800 is a great favorite. I than approximate a kind of normal distribution around that

Figures on institutional holdings (institutional ownership: 82.28% or roughly 41.034mn out of 50mn shares in total) and changes towards 31 Dec 2020 will be interesting.
Basic assumptions:
/the important base of large institutional shareholders currently neither buys nor sells in a large fashion: 13% of shareholders (105/792) account for 75% of shares held (32.6mn/41.0mn) 
/only few (278) medium-sized institutional investors reduced their holdings by 4.289mn shares (probably taking profit)
/a large number of institutional investors with smaller holding (409) almost completely absorbed the above mentioned shares (4.158mn shares bought) Two more figures that may explain the extreme skew of the 3m trend in late 2020:
ACTIVE POSITIONS 	HOLDERS 	||    SHARES
New Positions	140	||    679,852
Sold Out Positions	50	||    174,429 https://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/stocks/meli/institutional-holdings

Tried to be a reasonable fattish tail distribution around current price, with a slight upside skew given current dynamics. Come along way in a short time but good drivers for that so don’t think it deserves a downside skew.
